required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Spineology Clinical Outcomes Trial: An IDE Investigation
clinical_study.official_title: Spineology Clinical Outcomes Trial: An Investigation Device Exempt (IDE) Performance Goal Clinical Investigation

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluated the safety and effectiveness of the Spineology Interbody Fusion System (SIFS) in an instrumented interbody lumbar fusion in subjects presenting with symptomatic single-level lumbar degenerative disc disease.

detailed_description.textblock:
This regulated prospective, multi-center, Institutional Review Board (IRB) approved single-arm performance goal clinical investigation was conducted at 10 centers with 102 subjects being enrolled and treated.
Subjects were actively evaluated from pre-op to 24-months postoperative. Based on enrollment duration, some subjects were remotely assessed through self-administered surveys at 36- and/or 48-months.
The primary endpoint, assessed at 24-months postoperative, is a composite score that includes pain, function, fusion and safety assessments.

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of this trial is the rate of Patient Success at 24-months defined as a composite endpoint that includes: Pain -- Clinically meaningful reduction in low back pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score at 24-months post-operative. A clinically meaningful reduction is defined as a difference of at least 20 mm compared to pre-op (pre-op score minus post-op score). Function -- Clinically meaningful improvement in function at 24-months post-operative. A clinically meaningful improvement is defined as a reduction of at least 15 points compared to baseline (pre-op Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) score minus the post-op ODI score). Fusion -- Defined as bridging bone demonstrated on computed tomography (CT) scan Safety -- No device-related serious adverse events (SAEs) from intra-op through the 24-month timepoint. For the study to be a success, 68% of subjects need to meet the above success criteria.

other_outcome.measure: Mean Low Back Pain Score at 24-months Post-operative
other_outcome.description: A Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score was used to evaluate a subject's level of pain. The VAS is a 100 mm horizontal line where score of "0" represents "No Pain" and a score of "100" represents the "Worst possible" pain. The subject marks a vertical line across the horizontal line representing their pain level. The pain score is obtained by using a ruler to measure where the vertical line intersects the horizontal line. Improvement is defined as a clinically meaningful difference (20 mm reduction) when compared to pre-op. Success for this parameter is evaluated at the 24-month visit.

other_outcome.measure: Mean Back Function Score at 24-months Post-operative
other_outcome.description: A subject's back function was assessed by the Oswestry Disability Index (ODI). The ODI is a 10 question survey that evaluates the degree of functional impairment. Completion of the survey yields a score from "0" to "100" points. A score of "0" represents "No disability" and "100" represents "Total disability". A clinically meaningful difference is defined as a 15-point reduction when compared to pre-op. Success for this parameter is evaluated at the 24-month visit.

other_outcome.measure: Mean Right Leg Pain Score at 24-months Post-operative
other_outcome.description: A Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score was used to evaluate a subject's level of pain. The VAS is a 100 mm horizontal line where score of "0" represents "No Pain" and a score of "100" represents the "Worst possible" pain. The subject marks a vertical line across the horizontal line representing their pain level. The pain score is obtained by using a ruler to measure where the vertical line intersects the horizontal line. Improvement is defined as a clinically meaningful difference (20 mm reduction) when compared to pre-op. Success for this parameter is evaluated at the 24-month visit.

other_outcome.measure: Mean Left Leg Pain Score at 24-months Post-operative
other_outcome.description: A Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score was used to evaluate a subject's level of pain. The VAS is a 100 mm horizontal line where score of "0" represents "No Pain" and a score of "100" represents the "Worst possible" pain. The subject marks a vertical line across the horizontal line representing their pain level. The pain score is obtained by using a ruler to measure where the vertical line intersects the horizontal line. Improvement is defined as a clinically meaningful difference (20 mm reduction) when compared to pre-op. Success for this parameter is evaluated at the 24-month visit.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Bridging Bone Presence
other_outcome.description: Bridging bone demonstrated on CT scan. Independent Board-certified radiologists determine fusion status.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing a Device-Related Serious Adverse Event
other_outcome.description: Events adjudicated by Independent Spine Surgeon Committee that are determined to be a Device-Related Serious Adverse Event (SAE).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Neurological Maintenance or Improvement
other_outcome.description: Rate of subjects that were neurologically improved or maintained compared to baseline
Compared the number of participants working at 24-months to number of subjects working at baseline

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Narcotic Pain Medication
other_outcome.description: Narcotic pain medication use for back pain was compared to baseline.

other_outcome.time_frame: At the conclusion of the surgical procedure, an average of 2.6 hours
other_outcome.description: Blood loss (cc) reported for the surgical procedure.

other_outcome.time_frame: At the conclusion of the surgical procedure
From admission through discharge, an average of 2 days
other_outcome.description: Number of days subject was in the hospital (from admission to discharge).
Subjects rating their procedure as excellent or good

arm_group.description: This is a single-arm investigation. All subjects were treated with the SIFS device filled with bone graft. Posterior fixation required.

intervention.description: The SIFS mesh is a graft containment and reinforcement device. Following conventional thorough discectomy, the disc space is entered through a small portal in the annulus, the SIFS mesh is introduced, deployed and then filled with bone graft. Bilateral commercially available posterior lumbar fixation is applied.

facility.name: Bronson Healthcare Methodist Hospital - Neuroscience Center
Mayo Clinic Hospital - College of Medicine

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: SIFS Graft Containment Device
group.description: Investigation Group: Subjects underwent a lumbar interbody fusion using the SIFS Graft Containment Device and supplemental posterior fixation.

group.title: SIFS Graft Containment Device
group.description: Investigational SIFS graft containment device: The SIFS mesh is a graft containment and reinforcement device. Following conventional thorough discectomy, the disc space is entered through a small portal in the annulus, the SIFS mesh is introduced, deployed and then filled with bone graft. Bilateral commercially available posterior lumbar fixation is applied.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Low Back Pain Status
measure.description: A Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score was used to evaluate a subject's level of pain. The VAS is a 100 mm horizontal line where score of "0" represents "No Pain" and a score of "100" represents the "Worst possible" pain. The subject marks a vertical line across the horizontal line representing their pain level. The pain score is obtained by using a ruler to measure where the vertical line intersects the horizontal line. Improvement is defined as a clinically meaningful difference (20 mm reduction) when compared to pre-op. Success for this parameter is evaluated at the 24-month visit.

measure.title: Right Leg Pain Status
measure.description: A Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score was used to evaluate a subject's level of pain. The VAS is a 100 mm horizontal line where score of "0" represents "No Pain" and a score of "100" represents the "Worst possible" pain. The subject marks a vertical line across the horizontal line representing their pain level. The pain score is obtained by using a ruler to measure where the vertical line intersects the horizontal line. Improvement is defined as a clinically meaningful difference (20 mm reduction) when compared to pre-op. Success for this parameter is evaluated at the 24-month visit.

measure.title: Back Function Status
measure.description: A subject's back function was assessed by the Oswestry Disability Index (ODI). The ODI is a 10 question survey that evaluates the degree of functional impairment. Completion of the survey yields a score from "0" to "100" points. A score of "0" represents "No disability" and "100" represents "Total disability". A clinically meaningful difference is defined as a 15-point reduction when compared to pre-op. Success for this parameter is evaluated at the 24-month visit.

outcome.title: Overall Success
outcome.description: The primary endpoint of this trial is the rate of Patient Success at 24-months defined as a composite endpoint that includes: Pain -- Clinically meaningful reduction in low back pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score at 24-months post-operative. A clinically meaningful reduction is defined as a difference of at least 20 mm compared to pre-op (pre-op score minus post-op score). Function -- Clinically meaningful improvement in function at 24-months post-operative. A clinically meaningful improvement is defined as a reduction of at least 15 points compared to baseline (pre-op Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) score minus the post-op ODI score). Fusion -- Defined as bridging bone demonstrated on computed tomography (CT) scan Safety -- No device-related serious adverse events (SAEs) from intra-op through the 24-month timepoint. For the study to be a success, 68% of subjects need to meet the above success criteria.
outcome.population: A total of 96 subjects achieved a 24-month exam with complete data (data and CT imaging).

group.title: SIFS Investigation Gp
group.description: Investigational All subjects treated with the SIFS device, filled with bone graft. Posterior fixation applied.

measure.title: Overall Success
measure.description: The primary endpoint of this trial is the rate of Patient Success at 24-months defined as a composite endpoint that includes: Pain -- Clinically meaningful reduction in low back pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score at 24-months post-operative. A clinically meaningful reduction is defined as a difference of at least 20 mm compared to pre-op (pre-op score minus post-op score). Function -- Clinically meaningful improvement in function at 24-months post-operative. A clinically meaningful improvement is defined as a reduction of at least 15 points compared to baseline (pre-op Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) score minus the post-op ODI score). Fusion -- Defined as bridging bone demonstrated on computed tomography (CT) scan Safety -- No device-related serious adverse events (SAEs) from intra-op through the 24-month timepoint. For the study to be a success, 68% of subjects need to meet the above success criteria.
measure.population: A total of 96 subjects achieved a 24-month exam with complete data (data and CT imaging).

outcome.title: Mean Low Back Pain Score at 24-months Post-operative
outcome.description: A Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score was used to evaluate a subject's level of pain. The VAS is a 100 mm horizontal line where score of "0" represents "No Pain" and a score of "100" represents the "Worst possible" pain. The subject marks a vertical line across the horizontal line representing their pain level. The pain score is obtained by using a ruler to measure where the vertical line intersects the horizontal line. Improvement is defined as a clinically meaningful difference (20 mm reduction) when compared to pre-op. Success for this parameter is evaluated at the 24-month visit.
outcome.population: The 96 subjects identified represents all subjects that achieved a 24-month study exam. Of the 102 subjects enrolled and treated, 4 subjects exited prior to the 24-month study visit and 2 subjects missed their 24-month evaluation.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Experiencing a Device-Related Serious Adverse Event
outcome.description: Events adjudicated by Independent Spine Surgeon Committee that are determined to be a Device-Related Serious Adverse Event (SAE).
outcome.population: The 102 subjects identified represents all subjects enrolled and treated. All subject safety data through 24-months post-operative, regardless of whether a subject exited the study early, is included in the current data point analysis. Note that only 96 of the 102 subjects enrolled and treated achieved a 24-month study exam (4 subjects exited prior to the 24-month study visit and 2 subjects missed their 24-month evaluation).

reported_events.desc: All events were adjudicated by independent spine surgeon committee (not investigators).

group.title: Investigation Group
group.description: This is a single-arm investigation. All subjects were treated with the SIFS device filled with bone graft. Posterior fixation required.

event.description: Pulmonary thromboembolism requiring hospitalization, subject expired.
Secondary intervention due to spinal stenosis
Device improperly placed during index procedure

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: By design, this was a non-randomized trial; all subjects enrolled and treated in this performance goal investigation received the study device.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Rose Griffith, Sr. Director, Clinical Affairs
